Object.Name: oA Physical Push-Button Sensor
Object.Description1: The 'oA_Physical_Push-Button_Sensor' represents the physical part of a push-button sensor. All logical push-button sensors (object instances of 'oA Push-Button Sensor') are mapped to one physical push-button sensor.

Item.Name: Documentary Description
Item.Description: Resource to hold a documentary text description of the object.

Item.Name: Push-Button Status Value
Item.Description:
This Resource represents the current PRESSED/RELEASED state of the push-button.
* 0: RELEASED - the switch/push-button is pressed or contact is opened
* 1: PRESSED - the switch/push-button is pressed or contact is closed
* 2: FAULT - the contact is in a faulty condition (e.g. stuck or non-reactive)

Item.Name: Error Status
Item.Description: Error status is a bit coded value that shows all current errors on the object. The error status changes as soon as a new error occurs or an old one is resolved. Bitwise: 0 (LSB): Hardware_Error, 1: Quality_Error, 2: Invalid_State

Item.Name: Mounting Location
Item.Description: Describes the location of the device within the building. The content of the string is site specific.

Item.Name: Digital Input Polarity
Item.Description: The polarity of the digital input as a Boolean (0 = Normal (action makes), 1 = Reversed (action breaks) the contact)

Item.Name: Digital Input Debounce
Item.Description: The debounce period in ms [50]. \nThe debounce period is used to remove the small ripple of current that forms when a mechanical switch is pushed in an electrical circuit and makes a series of short contacts.
